message.content:
cs.CG, cs.GR, cs.NA, cs.DS, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the construction of anisotropic triangulations, which is a problem in computational geometry (cs.CG). The applications mentioned in the abstract, such as numerical solving of partial differential equations and representation of surfaces in graphics, suggest that the paper could also belong to the sub-category of computer graphics (cs.GR). The use of Riemannian metrics and Voronoi diagrams suggests that the paper could also be relevant to the sub-category of numerical analysis (cs.NA). The paper also discusses the theoretical aspects of the discrete Riemannian Voronoi diagram, which could make it relevant to the sub-category of data structures and algorithms (cs.DS). Finally, the experimental companion paper mentioned in the abstract suggests that the paper could also belong to the sub-category of social and information networks (cs.SI), as it may involve analyzing and visualizing data related to networks.
